title: Ala Kahakai National Historic Trail: Accessibility
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Accessibility             Accessibility        We hope you find this accessibility information to help you plan your visit. The trail traverses various terrain in several counties in Hawaii. The National Park service has visitor facilities at several sites. The trail can be unofficially accessed through sections within the four National Parks on the Island of Hawai'i including Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Pu'uhonua o Honaunau National Historical Park, Kaloko-Honokohau National Historical Park and Pu'ukohola National Historic Site. To help you plan your visit efficiently those sites have accessibility information. The National Park Service is committed to making all practicable efforts to make facilities, programs, services, employment, and meaningful work opportunities accessible and usable by all individuals.
